32  template <class DataRecord>
33  class TabularSatStore
34  {
35 
36  // typedefs had to be set to public for python bindings to compile
37  // these were originally in the protected block.
38  public:
39  // the data tables
41  typedef std::map<CommonTime, DataRecord> DataTable;
42 
44  typedef std::map<SatID, DataTable> SatTable;
45 
46  // member data
47  protected:

50  SatTable tables;

56  TimeSystem storeTimeSystem;

61  bool havePosition, haveVelocity, haveClockBias, haveClockDrift;
62 
66  bool checkDataGap;
67 
69  double gapInterval;
70 
74  bool checkInterval;

79  double maxInterval;

81  typedef typename DataTable::const_iterator DataTableIterator;

83  // member functions
84  public:
85 #pragma clang diagnostic push
86 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wreorder"
87  TabularSatStore() throw()
89  : havePosition(false), haveVelocity(false),
90  haveClockBias(false), haveClockDrift(false),
91  checkDataGap(false), checkInterval(false),
92  storeTimeSystem(TimeSystem::Any)

124  virtual DataRecord getValue(const SatID& sat, const CommonTime& ttag)
125  const throw(InvalidRequest) = 0;
126 
150  virtual bool getTableInterval(const SatID& sat,
151  const CommonTime& ttag,
152  const int& nhalf,
153  typename DataTable::const_iterator& it1,
154  typename DataTable::const_iterator& it2,
155  bool exactReturn=true)
156  const throw(InvalidRequest)
157  {
158  try {
159  static const char *fmt=" at time %F/%.3g %4Y/%02m/%02d %2H:%02M:%.3f %P";
160 
161  // find the DataTable for this sat
162  typename std::map<SatID, DataTable>::const_iterator satit;
163  satit = tables.find(sat);
164  if(satit == tables.end()) {
165  InvalidRequest
166  e("Satellite " + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + " not found.");
167  GPSTK_THROW(e);
168  }
169 
170  // this is the data table for the sat
171  const DataTable& dtable(satit->second);
172 
173  // cannot interpolate with one point
174  if(dtable.size() < 2) {
175  InvalidRequest e("Inadequate data (size < 2) for satellite "
176  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
177  GPSTK_THROW(e);
178  }
179 
180  // find the timetag in this table
181  // NB. throw here if time systems do not match and are not "Any"
182  it1 = dtable.find(ttag);
183  // is it an exact match?
184  bool exactMatch(it1 != dtable.end());
185 
186  // user must decide whether to return with exact value; e.g. without
187  // velocity data, user needs the interval to compute v from x data
188  if(exactMatch && exactReturn) return true;
189 
190  // lower_bound points to the first element with key >= ttag
191  it1 = it2 = dtable.lower_bound(ttag);
192  //LOG(INFO) << "Lower bound is " << printTime(it1->first,"%F/%g")
193  //<< " and begin() is " << printTime(dtable.begin()->first,"%F/%g");
194 
195  // ttag is <= first time in table
196  if(it1 == dtable.begin()) {
197  // at table begin but its an exact match && an interval of only 2
198  if(exactMatch && nhalf==1) {
199  ++(it2 = it1);
200  return exactMatch;
201  }
202  InvalidRequest e("Inadequate data before(1) requested time for satellite "
203  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
204  GPSTK_THROW(e);
205  }
206 
207  // move it1 down by one
208  if(--it1 == dtable.begin()) {
209  // if an interval of only 2
210  if(nhalf==1) {
211  ++(it2 = it1);
212  return exactMatch;
213  }
214  InvalidRequest e("Inadequate data before(2) requested time for satellite "
215  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
216  GPSTK_THROW(e);
217  }
218 
219  //LOG(INFO) << "OK, have interval " << printTime(it1->first,"%F/%g") <<
220  //" <= " <<printTime(ttag,"%F/%g")<< " < " <<printTime(it2->first,"%F/%g");
221 
222  // now have it1->first <= ttag < it2->first and it2 == it1+1
223  // check for gap between these two table entries surrounding ttag
224  if(checkDataGap && (it2->first-it1->first) > gapInterval) {
225  InvalidRequest e("Gap at interpolation time for satellite "
226  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
227  GPSTK_THROW(e);
228  }
229 
230  // now expand the interval to include 2*nhalf timesteps
231  for(int k=0; k<nhalf-1; k++) {
232  bool last(k==nhalf-2); // true only on the last iteration
233  // move left by one; if require full interval && out of room on left, fail
234  if(--it1 == dtable.begin() && !last) {
235  InvalidRequest
236  e("Inadequate data before(3) requested time for satellite "
237  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
238  GPSTK_THROW(e);
239  }
240  //LOG(INFO) << k << " expand left " << printTime(it1->first,"%F/%g");
241 
242  if(++it2 == dtable.end()) {
243  if(exactMatch && last && it1 != dtable.begin()) {
244  // exact match && at end of interval && with room to move down
245  it2--; it1--; // move interval down by one
246  }
247  else {
248  InvalidRequest
249  e("Inadequate data after(2) requested time for satellite "
250  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
251  GPSTK_THROW(e);
252  }
253  }
254  //LOG(INFO) << k << " expand right " << printTime(it2->first,"%F/%g");
255  }
256 
257  // check that the interval is not too large
258  if(checkInterval && (it2->first - it1->first) > maxInterval) {
259  InvalidRequest e("Interpolation interval too large for satellite "
260  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
261  GPSTK_THROW(e);
262  }
263 
264  return exactMatch;
265  }
266  catch(InvalidRequest& ir) { GPSTK_RETHROW(ir); }
267  }
268 
298  virtual bool getNonCenteredTableInterval(const SatID& sat,
299  const CommonTime& ttag,
300  const int& nhalf,
301  typename DataTable::const_iterator& it1,
302  typename DataTable::const_iterator& it2,
303  bool exactReturn=true)
304  const throw(InvalidRequest)
305  {
306  try {
307  // find the DataTable for this sat
308  typename std::map<SatID, DataTable>::const_iterator satit;
309  satit = tables.find(sat);
310  if(satit == tables.end()) {
311  InvalidRequest ir("Satellite " + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat)
312  + " not found.");
313  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
314  }
315 
316  // this is the data table for the sat
317  const DataTable& dtable(satit->second);
318  static const char *fmt=" at time %4Y/%02m/%02d %2H:%02M:%02S";
319 
320  // find the timetag in this table
321  // NB. throw here if time systems do not match and are not "Any"
322  it1 = dtable.find(ttag);
323  // is it an exact match?
324  bool exactMatch(it1 != dtable.end());
325 
326  // user must decide whether to return with exact value; e.g. without
327  // velocity data, user needs the interval to compute v from x data
328  if(exactMatch && exactReturn) return true;
329 
330  // lower_bound points to the first element with key >= ttag
331  it1 = it2 = dtable.lower_bound(ttag);
332 
333  // Should we allow to predict data?
334  if(it1 == dtable.end()) {
335  InvalidRequest ir("No data for the requested time of satellite "
336  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
337  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
338  }
339 
340  if(int(dtable.size()) < 2*nhalf) {
341  InvalidRequest ir("Inadequate data for satellite "
342  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
343  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
344  }
345 
346  // check for gap only when exactMatch==false
347  if(!exactMatch && checkDataGap) {
348  typename DataTable::const_iterator lit,rit;
349  lit = rit = it2;
350 
351  if(rit!=dtable.begin()) {
352  lit--;
353  if((rit->first-lit->first) > gapInterval) {
354  InvalidRequest ir(
355  "Gap at interpolation time for satellite "
356  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
357  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
358  }
359  }
360  else{
361  if((rit->first - ttag) > gapInterval) {
362  InvalidRequest ir(
363  "Gap may produce bad interpolation precision for satellite "
364  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
365  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
366  }
367  }
368  }
369 
370  // try to get the beginning of the window
371  int i, ileft(nhalf);
372  for(i = 0; i < nhalf; i++) {
373  if(it1 == dtable.begin()) break;
374  it1--;
375  ileft--;
376  }
377 
378  // try to get the ending of the window
379  int iright = nhalf - 1 + ileft;
380  for(i = 0; i < (nhalf-1+ileft); i++) {
381  it2++;
382  if(it2 == dtable.end()) {
383  it2--;
384  break;
385  }
386  iright--;
387  }
388 
389  // adjust the beginning of the window again
390  int ileft2 = iright;
391  for(i = 0; i < iright; i++) {
392  if(it1 == dtable.begin()) break;
393  it1--;
394  ileft2--;
395  }
396 
397  // We have checked that there are enough data, so ileft2 should
398  // always be zero.
399  if(ileft2 > 0) {
400  InvalidRequest ir("This should never happen");
401  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
402  }
403 
404  // check that the interval is not too large
405  if(checkInterval && (it2->first - it1->first) > maxInterval) {
406  InvalidRequest ir("Interpolation interval too large for satellite "
407  + gpstk::StringUtils::asString(sat) + printTime(ttag,fmt));
408  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
409  }
410 
411  return exactMatch;
412  }
413  catch(InvalidRequest& ir) { GPSTK_RETHROW(ir); }
414  }
415 
416  // interface like that of XvtStore
417 
425  virtual void dump(std::ostream& os = std::cout, int detail = 0) const throw()
426  {
427  os << " Dump of TabularSatStore(" << detail << "):" << std::endl;
428  if(detail >= 0) {
429  static std::string fmt("%4F %w %10.3g %4Y/%02m/%02d %2H:%02M:%02S %P");
430 
431  os << " Data stored for " << nsats() << " satellites" << std::endl;
432  os << " Time span of data: ";
433  CommonTime initialTime(getInitialTime());
434  initialTime.setTimeSystem(TimeSystem::Any);
435  os << " Initial time is " << printTime(initialTime,fmt) << std::endl;
436  CommonTime finalTime(getFinalTime());
437  if(initialTime == CommonTime::END_OF_TIME ||
438  finalTime == CommonTime::BEGINNING_OF_TIME)
439  os << "(there are no time limits)" << std::endl;
440  else
441  os << " FROM " << printTime(initialTime,fmt) << " TO "
442  << printTime(finalTime,fmt) << std::endl;
443 
444  os << " This store contains:"
445  << (havePosition ? "":" not") << " position,"
446  << (haveVelocity ? "":" not") << " velocity,"
447  << (haveClockBias ? "":" not") << " clock bias, and"
448  << (haveClockDrift ? "":" not") << " clock drift data." << std::endl;
449  os << " Checking for data gaps? " << (checkDataGap ? "yes":"no");
450  if(checkDataGap) os << "; gap interval is "
451  << std::fixed << std::setprecision(2) << gapInterval;
452  os << std::endl;
453  os << " Checking data interval? " << (checkInterval ? "yes":"no");
454  if(checkInterval) os << "; max interval is "
455  << std::fixed << std::setprecision(2) << maxInterval;
456  os << std::endl;
457 
458  if(detail > 0) {
459  typename SatTable::const_iterator it;
460  for(it=tables.begin(); it!=tables.end(); it++) {
461  os << " Sat " << it->first << " : "
462  << it->second.size() << " records.";
463 
464  if(detail == 1) { os << std::endl; continue; }
465 
466  // NB cannot access DataRecord without operator<<(DataRecord)
467  os << " Data:" << std::endl;
468  typename DataTable::const_iterator jt;
469  for(jt=it->second.begin(); jt!=it->second.end(); jt++)
470  os << " " << printTime(jt->first,fmt)
471  << " " << gpstk::StringUtils::asString(it->first)
472  << " " << jt->second // NB requires operator<<(DataRecord)
473  << std::endl;
474  }
475  }
476  }
477  os << " End dump of TabularSatStore." << std::endl;
478  }
479 
483  void edit(const CommonTime& tmin,
484  const CommonTime& tmax = CommonTime::END_OF_TIME) throw()
485  {
486  // loop over satellites
487  typename SatTable::iterator it;
488  for(it=tables.begin(); it!=tables.end(); it++) {
489  //sat = it->first;
490  DataTable& dtab(it->second);
491  typename DataTable::iterator jt;
492 
493  // delete everything above tmax
494  jt = dtab.upper_bound(tmax); // jt points to the earliest time > tmax
495  if(jt != dtab.end())
496  dtab.erase(jt,dtab.end());
497 
498  // delete everything before tmin
499  jt = dtab.lower_bound(tmin); // jt points to the earliest time >= tmin
500  if(jt != dtab.begin() && --jt != dtab.begin())
501  dtab.erase(dtab.begin(),jt);
502  }
503  }
504 
505  // remaining functions are not virtual
506 
508  inline void clear() throw() {
509  typename std::map<SatID, DataTable>::iterator satit;
510  for(satit=tables.begin(); satit!=tables.end(); ++satit)
511  satit->second.clear();
512  tables.clear();
513  }
514 
516  virtual bool isPresent(const SatID& sat) const throw()
517  { return (tables.find(sat) != tables.end()); }
518 
522  void checkTimeSystem(const TimeSystem& ts) const throw(InvalidRequest)
523  {
524  if(ts != TimeSystem::Any && storeTimeSystem != TimeSystem::Any
525  && ts != storeTimeSystem)
526  {
527  InvalidRequest ir("Conflicting time systems: "
528  + ts.asString() + " - " + storeTimeSystem.asString());
529  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
530  }
531  }
532 
536  CommonTime getInitialTime() const throw()
537  {
538  CommonTime initialTime(CommonTime::END_OF_TIME);
539  if(tables.size() == 0) return initialTime;
540 
541  // loop over satellites
542  typename SatTable::const_iterator it;
543  for(it=tables.begin(); it!=tables.end(); it++) {
544  const DataTable& dtab(it->second);
545  typename DataTable::const_iterator jt;
546  // update new time limits
547  if(dtab.begin() != dtab.end()) {
548  jt = dtab.begin();
549  if(jt->first < initialTime) initialTime = jt->first;
550  }
551  }
552 
553  return initialTime;
554  }
555 
558  CommonTime getFinalTime() const throw()
559  {
560  CommonTime finalTime(CommonTime::BEGINNING_OF_TIME);
561  if(tables.size() == 0) return finalTime;
562 
563  // loop over satellites
564  typename SatTable::const_iterator it;
565  for(it=tables.begin(); it!=tables.end(); it++) {
566  const DataTable& dtab(it->second);
567  typename DataTable::const_iterator jt;
568  // update new time limits
569  if(dtab.begin() != dtab.end()) {
570  --(jt = dtab.end());
571  if(jt->first > finalTime) finalTime = jt->first;
572  }
573  }
574 
575  return finalTime;
576  }
577 
578  // end interface like that of XvtStore (also hasVelocity() and isPresent())
579 
582  CommonTime getInitialTime(const SatID& sat) const throw()
583  {
584  CommonTime initialTime(CommonTime::END_OF_TIME);
585  if(tables.size() == 0) return initialTime;
586 
587  typename SatTable::const_iterator it(tables.find(sat));
588  if(it == tables.end()) return initialTime;
589 
590  return (it->second.begin())->first;
591  }
592 
595  CommonTime getFinalTime(const SatID& sat) const throw()
596  {
597  CommonTime finalTime(CommonTime::BEGINNING_OF_TIME);
598  if(tables.size() == 0) return finalTime;
599 
600  typename SatTable::const_iterator it(tables.find(sat));
601  if(it == tables.end()) return finalTime;
602 
603  typename DataTable::const_iterator jt(it->second.end());
604  --jt;
605  return jt->first;
606  }
607 
610  void dumpInterval(typename DataTable::const_iterator& it1,
611  typename DataTable::const_iterator& it2,
612  std::ostream& os = std::cout) const throw()
613  {
614  const char *fmt="%4Y/%02m/%02d %2H:%02M:%02S";
615  typename DataTable::const_iterator it(it1);
616  while(1) {
617  os << " " << printTime(it->first,fmt)
618  << " " << it->second << std::endl;
619  if(it == it2) break;
620  ++it;
621  };
622  }

625  bool hasPosition() const throw() { return havePosition; }
626  bool hasVelocity() const throw() { return haveVelocity; }
627  bool hasClockBias() const throw() { return haveClockBias; }
628  bool hasClockDrift() const throw() { return haveClockDrift; }
629 
631  inline int nsats(void) const throw() { return tables.size(); }
632 
634  bool hasSatellite(const SatID& sat) const throw()
635  { return isPresent(sat); }
636 
638  std::vector<SatID> getSatList(void) const throw()
639  {
640  std::vector<SatID> satlist;
641  typename SatTable::const_iterator it;
642  for(it=tables.begin(); it != tables.end(); ++it)
643  if(it->second.size() > 0) satlist.push_back(it->first);
644  return satlist;
645  }
646 
648  inline int ndata(void) const throw()
649  {
650  int n(0);
651  typename SatTable::const_iterator sit;
652  for(sit=tables.begin(); sit != tables.end(); ++sit)
653  n += sit->second.size();
654  return n;
655  }
656 
658  inline int ndata(const SatID& sat) const throw()
659  {
660  typename SatTable::const_iterator it(tables.find(sat));
661  if(it == tables.end()) return 0;
662  else return it->second.size();
663  }
664 
666  inline int ndata(const SatID::SatelliteSystem& sys) const throw()
667  {
668  int n(0);
669  typename SatTable::const_iterator sit;
670  for(sit=tables.begin(); sit != tables.end(); ++sit)
671  if(sit->first.system == sys)
672  n += sit->second.size();
673  return n;
674  }
675 
677  inline int size(void) const throw() { return ndata(); }
678 
681  double nomTimeStep(const SatID& sat) const throw()
682  {
683  // get the table for this sat
684  typename SatTable::const_iterator it(tables.find(sat));
685 
686  // not found or empty
687  if(it == tables.end() || it->second.size() == 0) return 0.0;
688 
689  // save the most frequent N step sizes
690  static const int N=3;
691  int i,ndt[N]={0,0,0};
692  double dt[N],del;
693 
694  // loop over the table
695  typename DataTable::const_iterator jt(it->second.begin());
696  CommonTime prevT(jt->first);
697  ++jt;
698  while(jt != it->second.end()) {
699  del = jt->first - prevT;
700  if(del > 1.0e-8) for(i=0; i<N; i++) {
701  if(ndt[i] == 0) { dt[i] = del; ndt[i] = 1; break; }
702  if(fabs(del-dt[i]) < 1.0e-8) { ndt[i]++; break; }
703  }
704  prevT = jt->first;
705  ++jt;
706  }
707 
708  // find the most frequent interval
709  del = dt[0];
710  for(i=1; i<N; i++) if(ndt[i] > ndt[0]) {
711  del = dt[i];
712  ndt[0] = ndt[i];
713  }
714 
715  return del;
716  }
717 
719  bool isDataGapCheck(void) throw() { return checkDataGap; }
720 
722  void disableDataGapCheck(void) throw() { checkDataGap = false; }
723 
725  double getGapInterval(void) throw() { return gapInterval; }
726 
728  void setGapInterval(double interval) throw()
729  { checkDataGap = true; gapInterval = interval; }
730 
732  bool isIntervalCheck(void) throw() { return checkInterval; }
733 
735  void disableIntervalCheck(void) throw() { checkInterval = false; }
736 
738  double getMaxInterval(void) throw() { return maxInterval; }
739 
741  void setMaxInterval(double interval) throw() {
742  checkInterval = true;
743  maxInterval = interval;
744  }
745 
747  TimeSystem getTimeSystem(void) throw() { return storeTimeSystem; }
748 
750  void setTimeSystem(const TimeSystem& ts) throw() { storeTimeSystem = ts; }
